snippet: A Senate bill to impose new sanctions on Iran, a top priority for the American Israel Public Affairs Committee, has stalled after stiff resistance from President Obama.
abstract: American Israel Public Affairs Committee once again finds itself in a very public standoff with the White House over a Senate bill to impose new sanctions on Iran; Aipac has stopped pressuring Senate Democrats to vote for the bill, which is unusual in that the organization has had great success pushing a raft of bills through Congress with unanimous support.
lead_paragraph: A Senate bill to impose new sanctions on Iran, a top priority for the American Israel Public Affairs Committee, has stalled after stiff resistance from President Obama.

headline.main: Potent Pro-Israel Group Finds Its Momentum Blunted
headline.print_headline: Potent Pro-Israel Group Finds Its Momentum Blunted
